alert.note: Alert for Clark; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 8:43AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Jefferson, Clark, Floyd, southern Scott, southeastern Washington, eastern Harrison, western Shelby, Nelson, southeastern Meade, Larue, western Marion, southeastern Grayson, southwestern Adair, eastern Edmonson, east central Warren, northwestern Cumberland, Barren, Oldham, western Henry, Hart, western Taylor, Jefferson, Hardin, Bullitt, Spencer, southern Trimble, Green, northeastern Monroe, north central Allen, southwestern Washington and Metcalfe Counties through 930 AM EDT/830 AM CDT/... At 843 AM EDT/743 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of La Grange to 10 miles southeast of Glasgow. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Grange. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Scott; Washington
